name: Tiananmen Square
info: This was one of my earliest trips to China, where all I had was marker and paper. I recall learning this style of art at my old art class, Yunhua Fang Art Studio.

name: Train
info: I vividly recall my dad helping me out with this one, looking up images of trains online. I remember I was baffled by the 3D shape of the train's visor.

name: Horse
info: My art teacher loved having us create pieces for the Chinese zodiac year. 2014 was the year of the horse.

name: Hot
info: It was fall and it was hot! My art teacher, annually, had us try to express the feeling of heat through art in some way. Here's my first attempt!

name: Turkey
info: My art class had an annual tradition of drawing turkeys too, since they have lots of layers, colors, and detail. Here's my rendition in marker.

name: Free To Be You And Me
info: I created this piece for a local play that happened to host a poster contest, and I won! The play is called: "Free To Be You And Me." I never ended up seeing the play.

name: Don't Wait, Check the Date!
info: This piece was for an art contest for the Palo Alto fire department. My first attempts at drawing people!

name: Bee
info: I used to be obsessed with bugs. Ladybugs, butterflies, roly-polys (or pillbugs). Here's me nerding out about the different parts of a bee.

name: Motorcycle
info: I vividly remember drawing this piece, and absolutely loving it. I spent so much time drawing on the tires that the paper eventually wrinkled and cracked.

name: Shellophoid
info: An after-school program I participated in only let you draw on Fridays, and only on eight-printer-paper slices. I would make up creatures, almost like Pokemon cards.

name: Mom's Day
info: I drew this for my mom for Mother's day, under the guidance of an art teacher. I managed to accurately depict muscles, neurons, and ex-vivo fertilization for some reason...

name: Paint Bottle
info: I don't even remember drawing this out of marker. It's a surprisingly realistic paint bottle my art teacher had lying around.

name: Rooster
info: Another Chinese zodiac piece, this time for 2017, the year of the rooster. It was meant to look almost like the Chinese paper cutouts people traditionally made.

name: Warning
info: My art teacher had a phase where he really loved designing warning signs. So, we followed along. Here's some of mine!

name: Ice Cream
info: One of those eighth-A4-paper sheets at my local after-school program. I kept doodling weekly, taking nearly all of their stock. It didn't matter, since I was the only one drawing anyways.

name: Doodle for Google
info: An art piece for Google's "Doodle for Google" art contest. I have a couple other types too, like one about DNA, and another one about poverty. Here we have bacteria and antibiotics.

name: Looking for Peace
info: A creative work that I did. We frequently did war/peace-related works at my old art studio. I like the wings on this one.

name: Muscle
info: An abstract piece I did for a 2D design course. The art teacher loved it a lot more than I thought necessary, given all I did was draw a wood/muscle looking thing. But the design isn't bad, looking back.

name: Flowers
info: We drew flowers and plants often in my old art studio. Here's one of them. I have tons of plants, leaves, flowers, anything green and living.

name: Bamboo
info: I tried out Chinese ink watercolor drawings under the guidance of another art teacher, not the one I've been with for about 7 years now. It was fun, but not my type, requiring too much patience.

name: Sketches (1)
info: One of my first times drawing not just other people/things, but other people/things very very quickly. My art teacher hosted a fun "draw whoever's around you" activity, so you can see others also sketching away.

name: Perspective
info: First time practicing perspective. I had a lot of fun deciding what to put in rooms, drawing ladders up/down floors, even creating an elevator.

name: Cranes
info: A piece I created for a family friend, kind of under the instruction of my parents, because they were getting old. This symbolizes longevity, if I recall correctly.

name: Jar
info: My first time working with acrylic on paper. It didn't turn out too bad!

name: Transcontinental Railroad
info: There was this huge contest locally, celebrating Chinese Americans for being descendants of those who worked on the transcontinental railroad, among being just a celebration of immigrants. Here was my submission.

name: First Landscape
info: My first time using acrylic on canvas, copying off a template piece. This was one of the first times I was at a new art studio, a much smaller one that focused more on technique.

name: Pig
info: Another Chinese zodiac piece, this time for 2019, the year of the pig. I was born in 2007, also the year of the pig. So I am exactly 12.

name: Volcano
info: I remember thinking this piece was so cool when I drew it.

name: Tiger
info: My art teacher became obsessed with tigers. We drew nothing but tigers for almost a month. On the bright side, I got really good.

name: Summer Palace
info: Sketches of the Summer Palace in China, on old, yellowing paper, with a dried out sharpie carried in a rusty metal tin I brought everywhere.

name: Peace
info: A piece I did for a UN contest. I never did win, but the teacher was proud of my work.

name: Wolf
info: One of 5 pieces I did of the same wolf, instructed by my art teacher. The others are all in different mediums: charcoal, marker, oil pastel, and pencil. This is colored pencil.

name: Ox
info: Ah yes, another Chinese zodiac piece. 2021, the year of the ox.

name: COVID
info: Inevitably, with circumstance comes art. Reflecting the pandemic at the time, I drew this piece.

name: Mandela
info: I do not remember why I drew this. All I recall is that it was difficult to maintain symmetry.

name: Tiger
info: Wow! Look! Another Chinese zodiac piece! 2022, the year of the tiger. Also the same zodiac my brother was born in; he's now 12.

name: Eye
info: I started going to this third art studio all the way in Foster City. This was a heavily technical art studio, so I instantly started back at the fundamentals, which I never mastered.

name: Second Landscape
info: My first acrylic piece at the new art studio, copying off of a template piece. It is an improvement.

name: Sketches (2)
info: Even more sketches done at my first art studio. Definitely got better at drawing people, but they still looked cartoony, with no anatomy.

name: Still Life (1)
info: Back at the new art studio, I learned a lot more pencil technique. Here's a copy of another piece.

name: Person (1)
info: At the new art studio, I was learning a lot more about how to draw what I saw before me. Here was a copy of a color HD photo.

name: Person (2)
info: I drew another person. This time, I decided to spice it up, adding some more things on top. I later digitally recolored this whole piece.

name: Person (3) / A Masked Reset
info: I drew yet another person. Again, I decided to add stuff on top, reflecting the waning pandemic. Turned out pretty cool.

name: Still Life (2)
info: A still life piece done with acrylic on canvas, over the course of a couple weeks. Turned out pretty good.

name: Person (4)
info: I drew yet another person, this time in acrylic. I needed some help from the art teacher at the new studio.

name: Veteran
info: A piece to commemorate veterans, after the recent full-scale invasion of Ukraine by Russia, along with an overall sense of tension in the world.

name: A Silent Man
info: A piece I made, totally independently. All I used as reference were pictures of keys and locks.

name: Open Minded
info: A piece I made, based on some source material, but heavily modified to have a totally different meaning. Kaboom!

name: A Curious Man
info: A piece I made, totally independently, free from any source material, other than Googling certain planets, outer space, or skulls and hands and apples.

name: A Cellular Crisis
info: An acrylic-on-canvas piece done purely creatively out of my imagination. Reflects the late nights my mom spent yelling on her phone. The blue was added afterward, digitally.

name: A Silent Man (color)
info: A colorized version of "A Silent Man."

name: Open Minded (color)
info: A colorized version of "Open Minded."

name: A Curious Man (color)
info: A colorized version of "A Curious Man."

name: A Masked Reset (color)
info: A colorized version of "Person (3) / A Masked Reset."
